title: Wrestling Chief's Reign Ends in Sexual Harassment Scandal: Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh Faces Accusations and Inquiry
content:
Brij Bhushan Sharan Singh, the controversial president of the Wrestling Federation of India, has been accused of sexual harassment by several prominent wrestlers, including Vinesh Phogat and Sakshee Malikkh. This scandal has led to Singh stepping aside for an inquiry, while the protesting wrestlers have called off their demonstration.

Singh, a six-time MP, has a history of controversy, including pending criminal cases and a heavy-handed approach in managing wrestling affairs. His reign has been marked by overbearing behavior, manipulation of referees, and alleged financial irregularities.  

The wrestlers' accusations of sexual exploitation and intimidation, along with their allegations of financial misappropriation, have shaken the Indian wrestling community and raised serious questions about the Federation's leadership. The outcome of the inquiry will determine Singh's future and the fate of Indian wrestling.
